column618: High-income countries, such as the United States, should help low-income countries through the labor market. Currently, companies (some being in the United States) will seek employees for labor endeavors in low-income countries due to lower wages. These companies should be willing to pay their employees wages equal to what an American is expected to make and not any less, even if that is an option. While this could be seen as an infringement upon capitalism and the idea of free market, this tactic would greatly help low-income countries fight poverty.  \n  \n Another option would be a progressive tax in order for the rich within the United States and other countries to pay forward a just amount that can be allocated to charities for low-income countries.

column1840:
There are several strategies that high-income countries can pursue to help fight extreme poverty in low-income countries. Here are a few: 
  
 Provide foreign aid: High-income countries can provide foreign aid in the form of financial assistance, technical expertise, and resources to help low-income countries address poverty and promote development. 
 Support economic growth: High-income countries can support economic growth in low-income countries by promoting trade, investment, and entrepreneurship. This can create jobs and opportunities for people in low-income countries to lift themselves out of poverty. 
 Provide debt relief: High-income countries can provide debt relief to low-income countries burdened by debt, allowing them to invest more in their own development and poverty-reduction efforts. 
 Address global health challenges: High-income countries can work with low-income countries to address global health challenges, such as HIV/AIDS, malaria, and maternal and child health. These efforts can improve health outcomes and reduce poverty. 
 Promote good governance: High-income countries can support efforts to promote good governance in low-income countries, including anti-corruption measures, human rights protections, and democratic institutions. This can help create a more stable and prosperous environment for poverty reduction and development.
